lines.text: Oh, a fourth at bridge, getting tables in restaurants. There comes a time when women band together. Sometimes they don't even call each other by their first names. Because they're not even friends.
I'm a postmaster. I suppose I should say "postmistress" but that sounds a bit racy to me.
You know I like the get well designs, and the birthday, but what's this anniversary here? You've drawn the wife with half a head.
That's the way I see wives.
We missed you at the awards banquet, Miss Jackson.
You sorry you missed the banquet?
Oh, I've forgotten every banquet I ever went to. But I'll always remember the one I missed!
Well that is the messiest pile of trays I have ever seen in a hotel corridor.
Did you see how we just came in, Harry? Got a table right away. Isn't life easy when there are two of you?
It shocks me, and I'd be very pleased if you liked me enough to be shocked too.
